comment: The polynomial remainder theorem, or little Bézout's theorem (by contrast to the regular Bézout's theorem ~ bezout ). If a polynomial ` F ` is divided by the linear factor ` x - A ` , the remainder is equal to ` F ( A ) ` , the evaluation of the polynomial at ` A ` (interpreted as a constant polynomial). This is part of Metamath 100 proof #89. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jul-2014.)
